awd_titl_txt: The Role of Benthic Organisms in the Degradation and        Preservation of Planktonic Lipids in Coastal Sediments
awd_abstract_narration: 9633603  SUN    Degradation rate constants for several planktonic lipid compound  will be investigated under controlled laboratory conditions.  Activity of benthic animals was the most likely factor causing the  difference observed between rate constants oxic and anoxic  sediments profiles measured in the field. Animals can alter  oxic/anoxic versus anoxic conditions in remineralization efficiency  and formation of intermediate products show that degradation  follows different pathways. Research will specially consider the  effects on degradation between oxic and anoxic conditions caused by  benthic animals. Radiolabelled tracers degradation rates and  pathways under various influences of benthic animals. Further  intensive study of the structure of metabolites produced during  incubation experiments will provide a more detailed picture of the  degradation of these important compounds.
